member.summary: Name of the cache item the control will use.
member.remarks: By setting this name dynamically, you can achieve caching based on URL parameter or some other variable - simply put the value of the parameter to the CacheItemName property. If no value is set, the control stores its content to the item named "URL|ControlID".

member.name: M:CMS.DocumentEngine.Web.UI.DocumentListMassActionsUrlGenerator.SetRefreshNodeId(System.Collections.Hashtable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},CMS.DocumentEngine.Web.UI.DocumentListMassActionsParameters)
member.summary: Sets the refresh node id in the given parameters hash table.

member.name: M:CMS.DocumentEngine.Web.UI.DocumentListMassActionsUrlGenerator.GetRefreshNodeID(CMS.DocumentEngine.TreeNode,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets the refresh node ID. This method checks all parent nodes and indicates whether any of them is contained in the selected node ids list. If none of the parent nodes is contained in the list, this method returns 0 (it means that the current wopener node can be used for refreshing the dialog). If any of the parent nodes is contained in the list, this method returns the parent node id (this node will be used for refreshing the dialog).

member.summary: Name of the cache item the control will use.
member.remarks: By setting this name dynamically, you can achieve caching based on URL parameter or some other variable - simply put the value of the parameter to the CacheItemName property. If no value is set, the control stores its content to the item named "URL|ControlID".

member.name: P:CMS.DocumentEngine.Web.UI.CMSRepeater.CacheItemName
member.summary: Name of the cache item the control will use.
member.remarks: By setting this name dynamically, you can achieve caching based on URL parameter or some other variable - simply put the value of the parameter to the CacheItemName property. If no value is set, the control stores its content to the item named "URL|ControlID".
